key.name: path
key.description: This is the path in which wallpaper files reside.

key.name: recursive
key.description: Set this to load all wallpaper files from the path not just first level. This makes sense if you have a multilevel structure and you want to point the app to the top level.

key.name: interval
key.description: This is the interval between wallpaper switches.

key.name: schedule
key.description: Set this to true if you want to toggle automatic wallpaper changes.

key.name: save
key.description: Set this to true if you want to load the previous list, otherwise it will be recreated on each start.

key.name: reconcile
key.summary: Reconcile Wallpaper List During Application Load
key.description: Set this to true if you want to reconcile the previous list during load, otherwise it will load the file list as it was stored in the settings.

key.name: verify-presence
key.description: Set this to true if you want to verify the presence of the file on the filesystem before setting a wallpaper, if not the file is purged from the list. This makes sense if you disable reconcile.

key.name: verify-image
key.summary: Verify Wallpaper File is an Image
key.description: Set this to true if you want to verify that the current file is actually an image. If not then the file is purged from the list.

key.name: saved-list
key.description: Saved List of Wallpapers, do not edit this!

key.name: favorites
key.description: Saved List of Favorite Wallpapers, do not edit this!

key.name: next-key
key.description: Global key combination to trigger next wallpaper.

key.name: previous-key
key.description: Global key combination to trigger previous wallpaper.

key.name: favorite-key
key.description: Global key combination to add current wallpaper to the favorites.

key.name: current-favorite-list
key.description: This contains the name of the current favorites list, if one is active.

key.name: optimize-stored-lists
key.description: Set this to true to optimize the disk space used in GSettings for the saved and favorites lists.
